channel.title: William Gosset on Stat 150 at Cal Poly
channel.description: Recent content in William Gosset on Stat 150 at Cal Poly

item.title: How a Guiness Beer Brewer Created T-Tests
item.description: “The rule of law can be wiped out in one misguided, however, well intentioned, generation” -William Gosset Although William Sealy Gosset is one of the least known contributors to modern statistics, his work is still widely referenced today. He was born in Canterbury, England on June 13, 1876 to Agnes Sealy Vidal and Colonel Frederic Gosset. Gosset attended Winchester College before studying chemistry and mathematics at Oxford.
